learning_outcomes.description: Solve a variety of first order and second order Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs)
Derive properties of the hyperbolic functions and apply them in various mathematical contexts.
Understand and apply aspects of the theory of multi-dimensional integrals, using a variety of coordinate systems.
Apply differential calculus to the context of vector functions. Specifically, work with Grad, Div and Curl and understand their significance.
Apply integral calculus to the context of vector functions. Specifically, use surface and flux integrals, and the theorems of Green, Gauss and Stokes.
Understand and apply eigenvalues, eigenvectors and diagonalisation of matrices in a variety of contexts.
Apply concepts of orthogonality and inner product spaces to the method of least squares, best fit and function approximation
Model and solve problems with real-world application using mathematical techniques covered in this course.
Present clear and concise mathematical arguments in assignments and exams.

assessments.task_description: Assignments must be downloaded from the course blackboard website. Your assignments will comprise of questions extending the problem-solving techniques based on practice problems and exercises covered in the course workbook. You must submit detailed written solutions to a collection of mathematical problems. Each assignment is equally weighted.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit this assessment item through the link in Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Course lectures

Lectures will be on-campus. There are 3 face-to-face lectures per week.

learning_activities.topic:

Most weeks there is one pre-recorded lecture that students should watch, that will not be covered in contact lectures

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(04 Aug - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Applied Classes

Applied Classes provide students with an opportunity for individual assistance with the course and with the assignments. To get the most out of the applied classes, students should attempt problems beforehand. The problem sheets will not be distributed in class but can be downloaded from the course Blackboard page.
